intro: Lastreopsis effusa var. divergens, commonly known as the divergent lastreopsis, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, lacey appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, which is a common trait among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
